Experience Center Executive Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Experience Center Executive
     

            
    



Job Location: Festac, Lagos
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type: Onsite
Department: EasyBuy Direct Sales
Reporting To: Solar Inverter Manager

About the role


	The Sun King Experience Center Executive is task with  overseeing  the overall wellbeing of the experience center, inventory management and ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.
	This role also assist the Sun King Experience Center Supervisor in generating sales prospect and converting them into actual sales. This role reports to the Solar Inverter Manager.


Responsibilities
Inventory management:


	Coordinate with warehouse to receive stock and keep track of inventory
	Issue out stocks to cash sales customers as per requirement
	Maintain an updated Goods Received and Goods Issued log online
	Perform daily cycle counts and monthly stock take
	Scan in and out Sun King inventory on a serial basis
	Communicate any inventory shortage, theft, or loss at the zonal warehouse


Reports:


	Prepare daily on hand stock report for stakeholders use
	Report on daily issued out stock for replacement and or replenishment


Repairs:


	Repairs and Spare Parts management
	Receive faulty components, identify the technical issue and verify warranty eligibility through several technical checks
	Perform basic check on the faulty units before replacement


Store management:


	Ensure the center is well maintained tidy and that the store arrangement is per SKU.
	Ensure neatness and good ambiance of the experience center at all times.
	Observation of safety procedures to avert hazards at the experience center.
	Welcome walk-in customers and provide assistance as necessary.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	 A Degree or its equivalent from a recognized institution in any related field.
	At least 1 years of hands on experience in a related role.
	Effective verbal, communication and people skills.
	Is able to demonstrate high levels of integrity with a proactive and positive attitude.
	A good customer centric attitude and focus.
	A team player spirit with high levels of flexibility.
	Possess good problem-solving skills.
	Ability to gauge client needs.
	Familiarity with MS Excel and MS Word


What Sun King offers


	Professional growth in a dynamic, rapidly expanding, high-social-impact industry
	An open-minded, collaborative culture made up of enthusiastic colleagues who are driven by the challenge of innovation towards profound impact on people and the planet.
	A truly multicultural experience: you will have the chance to work with and learn from people from different geographies, nationalities, and backgrounds.
	Structured, tailored learning and development programs that help you become a better leader, manager, and professional through the Sun Center for Leadership.


Salary
N140,000 / Month.

Administrative Officer Job at Intersex Nigeria




        
    

        
        Intersex Nigeria (Center for Healthcare Development and Youth Empowerment) is an intersex-led and focused Non-Governmental Organization in Nigeria. We promote and advocate for the sexual reproductive health, self-determination, bodily autonomy, and overall human rights of intersex people in all diversity in Nigeria. Through community building, advocacy, evidence-based research, empowerment, educational and informational resources on intersex-related issues to the public, partners, stakeholders, and our community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Duration: 12 months (Renewable)
     

            
    



About the position


	The Administrative Officer will provide administrative, logistical, and procurement support to ensure the efficient functioning of the organization.
	The role is critical in supporting programs, events, and daily operations while ensuring transparency, accountability, and value for money.


Key Responsibilities
Procurement and Supply Chain Management:


	Support the procurement process in line with policies, ensuring value for money, transparency, and timely delivery.
	Prepare and maintain procurement plans and vendor databases.
	Solicit quotations, evaluate bids, and prepare purchase orders and procurement documentation.
	Track the delivery and receipt of goods and services, ensuring proper documentation and reconciliation.


Logistics and Event Coordination:


	Coordinate logistical arrangements for workshops, trainings, conferences, and field missions.
	Arrange venue bookings, transportation, accommodation, and catering for staff and participants.
	Prepare logistics briefs and itineraries for field activities.


Travel and Fleet Management:


	Manage official travel logistics for staff, consultants, and visitors, including ticketing and clearances.
	Maintain a schedule for vehicle use, fuel consumption, and driver assignments.
	Ensure compliance with safety and security protocols during official travel.


Administrative Support & Compliance:


	Maintain filing systems and procurement documentation.
	Ensure activities comply with internal controls, ethical standards, and donor requirements.
	Support the preparation of administrative and procurement reports and assist with audits.


Coordination & Onboarding:


	Collaborate with Finance and Program teams to align logistics with project timelines.
	Support the onboarding of staff, consultants, and volunteers as required.


Key Skills and Qualifications


	Procurement & Logistics: Strong knowledge of procurement procedures, supply chain management, and inventory control.
	Organizational Management: Proven ability to coordinate multiple priorities under deadlines with high attention to detail.
	Communication & Interpersonal: Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills for stakeholder coordination.
	Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with Zoho software is a plus.
	Integrity & Values: High level of accountability and commitment to human rights and intersex-affirming values.


Salary
N200,000 / Month (Net)

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: jobs@intersexnigeria.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Intersex Nigeria is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from qualified individuals regardless of gender, sex, sexual orientation, (dis)ability, religion, or ethnic background.
